name: Charlotte's B&B

reviews.text: I stayed with Charlotte and Vinay for 4 nights at the start of April.I,m a solo traveller and this was the first time i have done a homestay.Charlotte,Vinay,and the star of the house, Juhi,made me feel so welcome from the moment i arrived until the moment i left.Nothing was a problem for them from getting me a new sim card for my phone,personally taking me to the Metro and giving me a Metro card,to enable me to get around Delhi easily,taking me out on my first night with Vinay driving,to Blues Bar then going for food at local restaurant the hospitality was excellent.The house is located in New Rajinder Nagar,a five minute walk from Rajendra place metro which in turn takes you to the heart of Delhi,Connaught Place in another five minutes..an excellent location.The house itself is open plan with my room having access to a balcony overlooking a peaceful park..excellent..Breakfast is served when you want with a great selection,different every day.When sightseeing,knowing that the house was 10 to 15 mins away with peace and quite,really made my trip to Delhi.Charlotte,Vinay,and Juhi really did make me feel at home and always had time for me.I highly reccommend staying with them when in Delhi and i would not hesitate to return.Well done keep up the good work.....
reviews.title: Excellent Homestay with Excellent Hospitality.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Charlotte is the most attentive hoist and her place is very comfortable. We would not have enjoyed our stay half as much without this oasis to return to after a hard day traveling. The central location is a great advantage and time saver. She provided the best recommendations on how to spend our 6 days there.
reviews.title: An oasis in Delhi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Charlotte was a lovely host, and very helpful both before and during our stay. It is true that there are cheaper places to stay but Charlottes help with those simple things that can seem difficult in a new country are worth every penny. Charlotte can also arrange extended trips with drivers. We had already booked a 38day trip with Intrepid but I would say if you are looking taylor make your own journey it is worth asking Charlotte for a quote and itinery.
reviews.title: An excellent introduction to Delhi life......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Charlottes after reading reviews on trip advisor. We were greeted at the door by Charlotte after arriving from Dehli airport and were given a lovely refreshing drink. Charlotte had aranged all our taxis and had pre booked our train tickets to Agra before we arrived. She also arranged for us to be picked up in Agra and and taken to the Taj Mahal and Red Fort. The driver was a God send as Agra and surrounding areas can be quite daunting. During the tour and after returning to Dehli Charlotte kept in touch to make sure we were both ok. Her BnB is in an excellent location for using the metro which is about a 5 minutes walk away. We had a wander round on the first night and found it quite an eye opener but never felt threatened or unsafe. We returned on a pedal powered rickshaw which made a nice change. We cannot praise Charlottes highly enough, and highly recommend it. If you are planning a stay in Dehli this is the place to go. One word of warning, if you are catching the train at Delhi do not get conned by official looking people who ask to see your tickets and then inform you they are invalid unless checked at the tourist information office. It's all a con to get money out of you. It nearly caught us out. We would never have managed to see all the things we wanted to see without Charlotte's help and advice, she made our stay in Delhi stress free.
reviews.title: LOVELY BnB AND SO MUCH MORE
A home from home...
reviews.text: We were travelling around India as five single women from London and Delhi was our first stop. In a city as crazy as this, the BnB was an oasis of calm! Charlotte herself was very welcoming and arranged our car from the airport as well as arranging a day trip to the Taj Mahal and Fattehpur Sikri with a lovely, patient driver. When one of our party got really ill on the first night Charlotte was amazing and looked after her, insisting that we go and see the Taj Mahal and she would look after our friend. She brought her food and liquids all through the day and was like a second mum! I would reccommend staying here. The room was spotlessly clean, the breakfasts were lovely and Charlotte's knowledge and tips were so helpful. She even gave us a packed lunch as we were leaving for our long train ride to Varanasi! Great place to stop in Delhi.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here at the beginning of our trip in India. It's a very nice place and Charlotte is very nice and helpful. The rooms are comfortable and cosy, after travelling for a few months it felt like home. Delhi is really busy and crowded and intense, especially Old Delhi and it's nice that you can go to this quiet en safe place after sightseeing. And it's very well located near Karol Bagh metro and market, from there you can travel to the other parts of Delhi. Charlotte helped us with many things and she helped us planning our itinerary through India. We are very satisfied!
reviews.title: safe and comfortable place in intense Delhi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Charlotte was a great host and a huge life saver with all of her recommendations and connections with drivers and other B&B hosts in India. From our first email regarding availability, Charlotte helped us with everything from arranging the airport pick up and other B&B bookings for the rest of our trip to being an excellent host when we finally arrived. Our first India trip was a huge success thanks to all of Charlotte's help!
reviews.title: Highly recommended B&B

reviews.title: An excellent jumping off point for travels through India

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms at Charlotte's were very comfortable, clean and nicely decorated--everything you'd hope for in a casual b&b. Not 5 star luxury, just homey comfort. At Charlotte's you truly are staying with the family, which can be a rewarding experience, particularly for first-timers to India (like us!). The neighborhood is very safe, pleasant, and relatively central, though not actually in the middle of everything--you will need to use the metro or a tuk-tuk to get around. Most importantly, the area is completely devoid of tourists and the touts that come with them, which can be a refreshing experience for non-Indian travellers and a great way to get off the beaten path in Delhi. More than all of this, however, I would recommend Charlotte's because the hostess (Charlotte herself) is extremely gracious, helpful and enthusiastic about running her b&b. It is rare to come across a b&b owner who so thoroughly enjoys the day-to-day operations of the b&b and meeting guests' needs.
reviews.title: An extremely pleasant stay and an enthusiastic host

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Charlotte's Bed and Breakfast is absolutely beautiful. The room is beautifully furnished and lovely and clean with laptop and flatscreen tv. The bathroom has a power shower with 24 hour hot water. The breakfast is amazing. A mixture of continental and indian made freshly while you relaxed. Charlotte is a lovely host and nothing is too much trouble. She has lots of valuable advice to ensure that your stay in New Delhi is exactly what you are after. It's situated in a quiet location but close enough to Karol Bagh.
reviews.title: Fabulous place to stay

reviews.text: It was wonderful to arrive in Delhi and be greeted by Charlotte and her wonderful family. They were as caring and helpful as anyone can be. I felt right at home and anything I needed they could provide. It was cold so they went out and bought space heaters!!! If you go in January, bring warm clothes no matter what. And the b&b is not exactly in the center of town, so you will need to take the subway or a taxi. But this isn't a hotel. It's a home stay and if that's what you want, then Charlotte will provide it and you will have a true India experience. I loved being here and plan to come again with my own family and stay for several days.
reviews.title: A Home Away from Home

reviews.text: As this was my first trip to India and I was travelling alone, I wanted to make sure that I started off on the right foot, and I couldn't have chosen a better place.
reviews.title: Perfect introduction to India

reviews.text: Charlotte had someone waiting to fetch me from the airport even though my flight was an hour late. From the time I arrived at her place I felt at ease. Her advice was invaluable. I always left her house confident about where to go, how to get there and, very importantly, how much I should pay if I took an auto or a rickshaw. Thanks to her I explored places I would never have gone to if I had just followed my book. Her place is really close to the metro and is a few stops to the centre. She also has a local market street on the way to the metro, where I was able to get a phone, some photographs, a sim card and a water bottle.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hospitality Feels Like Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: after a horrendous 36 hour train journey, arriving at Charlotte's at 2am and finding a homely room with fresh, clean sheets and a lovely warm shower was the absolute best! Charlotte is the consumate host and is full of useful hints about Delhi. Especially the tip for the tailor.
reviews.title: Charlotte is the consumate host

reviews.text: Left with a great impression. Charlotte and her family are able to help with any need while in Delhi, and the rooms are great.
reviews.title: A pleasant place to base a trip to Delhi

reviews.text: Charlotte's BnB is a safe haven for the newcomer to India. This is a home away from home. Faced with the challenges of adapting to the pace and energy of New Delhi, Charlotte's BnB offers the visitor a gradual and easy transitory space for adjusting to this new experience. I received this recommendation by word of mouth, and I was very happy indeed.
reviews.title: A Safe Haven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Charlottes BnB is a little gem of a place to stay in New Delhi. We stayed here for 11 nights, as there was plenty to do and see in Delhi. It is a good area to stay, lovely, quiet and safe. The Metro is only 10 minutes walk away. We also discovered a lovely eating place 20 minutes walk away called Spicy by Nature in the near by area of Karol Bagh. The hospitality at Charlottes BnB is very warm and welcoming. The rooms are very clean, well serviced each day, and the beds were turned down prior to our return at the end of the day, making it warm and cosy after a tiring day of sightseeing.
reviews.title: A little gem

reviews.text: Charlotte was very helpful in booking our taxis to and from the airport and our train ticket to Agra. They were also very understanding when our train from Agra was delayed and we didn't end up getting in until 3.30am. We tried to contact them by mobile but that failed, we were therefore very impressed that they contacted the rail station to get the lastest information on our train arrival back into Delhi. When you visit Delhi also make sure you find the time to visit the Taj Mahal - a stunning and beautiful place. We are talking from experience, take the fast train to Agra and not the Taj Express.
reviews.title: Great BnB!
